title: PAWNSHOP / SHELF OF BOOMBOXES
description: You look at and ask Roy about the boombox.

dialogueTree.title: Shelf of Boomboxes: "All the old boomboxes are there, bl..."
dialogueTree.text: All the old boomboxes are there, blinking and waiting to whirl. All but one: yours.

dialogueTree.title: Shelf of Boomboxes: "The boomboxes wait on the shelves...."
dialogueTree.text: The boomboxes wait on the shelves. And your boombox -- that gold and amber Harmon Wowshi -- stares at you longingly with its tape reel eyes.

links.title: You: ""Shopkeep, this Stereo 8 approved m..."
links.text: "Shopkeep, this Stereo 8 approved machine here..."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""...is the Harmon Wowshi W02 -- mad..."
links.text: "...is the Harmon Wowshi W02 -- made in Vesper, designed in Seol," he says. "Plays all reel-to-reel formats: 2mm, 8mm, 12mm. It's even got a little radio in there. It'll set you back 12 re√°l."

links.title: You: ""What I really want to know is... c..."
links.text: "What I really want to know is... could this device come handy in my police work?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""If police work means playing tapes..."
links.text: "If police work means playing tapes, sure. You can use it for that. Or any other time you'd need to play a tape."

links.title: Inland Empire: "Like at a beach party. With sand an..."
links.text: Like at a beach party. With sand and sun and seagulls dancing on the breeze.

links.title: You: "(Turn to Kim.) "Theoretically: coul..."
links.text: (Turn to Kim.) "Theoretically: could I bring it to a beach party?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't think the 'Doorgunner Mega..."
links.text: "I don't think the 'Doorgunner Megamix' will be good party material. Something about the name..."

links.title: You: ""Okay Kim. I'll just rock out with..."
links.text: "Okay Kim. I'll just rock out with Roy then."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""I don't like beaches. They accumul..."
links.text: "I don't like beaches. They accumulate too many photons, it's always chaos out there. But live your life, man. You can use it at a beach party if you want."

links.title: You: ""Actually, it doesn't have to be a..."
links.text: "Actually, it doesn't have to be a beach. With a boombox like that, I'll bring the party into the streets!"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""You can play it anywhere you like...."
links.text: "You can play it anywhere you like. And I guess since you're are a police officer, no one can arrest you for it."

links.title: You: ""You're right. It's really The End..."
links.text: "You're right. It's really The End that I need it for: a Requiem For All Lifeforms."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""It'll play that," the man nods. "A..."
links.text: "It'll play that," the man nods. "Any Requiem really. Also dirges. Madrigals. Chants. As long as it's on tape."

links.title: Conceptualization: "Sounds like he's already heard the..."
links.text: Sounds like he's already heard the Requiem For All Lifeforms and wasn't that impressed.

links.title: You: ""You're right, Kitsuragi. Work firs..."
links.text: "You're right, Kitsuragi. Work first. Party later."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That is the unofficial RCM motto,..."
links.text: "That is the unofficial RCM motto, yes."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "It's not, sadly."
links.text: It's not, sadly.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Theoretically, yes. But we don't h..."
links.text: "Theoretically, yes. But we don't have time right now. It's generally: murder investigation first, *then* beach party."

links.title: You: ""Thanks for clearing that up, Roy.""
links.text: "Thanks for clearing that up, Roy."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""For sure. It's a consumer device w..."
links.text: "For sure. It's a consumer device with professional applications."

links.title: You: ""Are you sure this is all in workin..."
links.text: "Are you sure this is all in working order?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Absolutely. I've tested each one m..."
links.text: "Absolutely. I've tested each one myself with recordings of speech, found sounds, and music from a variety of genres. Even though," he grimaces, "I don't really like music."

links.title: Conceptualization: "That's odd. Why doesn't he like mus..."
links.text: That's odd. Why doesn't he like music?

links.title: You: ""Don't like music? What do you like..."
links.text: "Don't like music? What do you like then?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""The stuff I record myself -- silve..."
links.text: "The stuff I record myself -- silverware shaking in drawers as motorcars race by, nocturnal animals climbing on the roof, airship rotors, that kind of thing."

links.title: Conceptualization: "Hmm... maybe you should ditch music..."
links.text: Hmm... maybe you should ditch music as well, get into these more *experimental* sounds he's describing?

links.title: You: ""Got it. Back to this guy..." (Tap..."
links.text: "Got it. Back to this guy..." (Tap the boombox on its speaker.)

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""He is a good one, that. Weather re..."
links.text: "He is a good one, that. Weather resistant."

links.title: You: ""Can I just play a tape on one of t..."
links.text: "Can I just play a tape on one of the boomboxes real quick?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Sorry, man. I can't be giving out..."
links.text: "Sorry, man. I can't be giving out freebies. Never have, won't now."

links.title: You: ""Thanks for the discount, man. Here..."
links.text: "Thanks for the discount, man. Here's the money for the boombox."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""And here you are. Quality sound re..."
links.text: "And here you are. Quality sound reproduction on the go. It'll play anything. Wherever. Turn *any* tape into a conversation of sounds and shapes."

links.title: You: ""Thanks for the discount, man. Here..."
links.text: "Thanks for the discount, man. Here's the money for the boombox."

links.title: You: ""Thanks for the discount, man. Here..."
links.text: "Thanks for the discount, man. Here's the money for the boombox."

links.title: You: ""I need to buy that boombox.""
links.text: "I need to buy that boombox."

links.title: You: ""I want to buy that boombox.""
links.text: "I want to buy that boombox."

links.title: You: ""Can I get a discount on this boomb..."
links.text: "Can I get a discount on this boombox? A *police* discount."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""A discount? I do have to keep the..."
links.text: "A discount? I do have to keep the lights on, man. It's twelve re√°l."

links.title: Half Light: "A man like that in a neighbourhood..."
links.text: A man like that in a neighbourhood like this? In a rickety house falling into the sea? There's fear in him. Use it to your advantage.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Careful. You can only do this once."
links.text: Careful. You can only do this once.

links.title: You: ""Fair enough, business man. Twelve..."
links.text: "Fair enough, business man. Twelve it is."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Twelve is a good number. Good inte..."
links.text: "Twelve is a good number. Good internal balance." He studies the light on the wall. "Twelve has integrity."

links.title: You: ""How does ten re√°l sound?""
links.text: "How does ten re√°l sound?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Sounds like a ripoff, but okay. I..."
links.text: "Sounds like a ripoff, but okay. I can make it ten -- but no lower."

links.title: You: ""Let's make it eight re√°l.""
links.text: "Let's make it eight re√°l."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Actually, yes. Let's. Eight is an..."
links.text: "Actually, yes. Let's. Eight is an even better number than twelve. Even more internal balance." He observes the light on the wall and adds: "Better integrity too."

links.title: You: ""Aren't you afraid of *masked gunme..."
links.text: "Aren't you afraid of *masked gunmen*? The roof falling in? Killer waves? Aircraft accidents? Botched surgeries? I'll buy it for four re√°l."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""No, not really. I expect momentous..."
links.text: "No, not really. I expect momentous change at any moment... But it seems that *you* are." He almost sounds concerned and seems to weigh your offer.

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Fine." He nods decisively. "Four r..."
links.text: "Fine." He nods decisively. "Four re√°l it is."

links.title: Half Light: "Succcess!!! Sort of. Whatever gets..."
links.text: Succcess!!! Sort of. Whatever gets the job done, right?

links.title: You: ""I'm not just doing *any* police wo..."
links.text: "I'm not just doing *any* police work -- I've got *THE DOORGUNNER MEGAMIX* here! An era-defining work. Let's do four re√°l."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He purses his lips. "Four re√°l is o..."
links.text: He purses his lips. "Four re√°l is offensively low... but just this once. For the *musique concr√®te* cop."

links.title: You: ""Let me hit you with this: four re√°..."
links.text: "Let me hit you with this: four re√°l. Huh? Whaddya say?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""I say: it's twelve re√°l. Four is a..."
links.text: "I say: it's twelve re√°l. Four is a total ripoff. It's not even a number."

links.title: Suggestion: "What did I say? And what did you do..."
links.text: What did I say? And what did you do? Damn it, man. You're buying it for twelve now, I guess.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Remember -- he doesn't like music...."
links.text: Remember -- he doesn't like music. He likes *sounds*. The *Doorgunner Megamix* is his type of tape! Certainly he'd give you a discount if he knew you'd play something so *experimental*.

links.title: Suggestion: "Just don't ask him for the smallest..."
links.text: Just don't ask him for the smallest amount. You'll insult him. The others will work.

links.title: Rhetoric: "He seems like an *experimental* man..."
links.text: He seems like an *experimental* man. And what sonic experience is more experimental than the *Doorgunner Megamix*? Certainly he'd give you a discount if he knew you'd play that.

links.title: You: "That's all. [Leave.]"
links.text: That's all. [Leave.]

dialogueTree.title: Shelf of Boomboxes: "The boomboxes on the shelf look wel..."
dialogueTree.text: The boomboxes on the shelf look well-loved and well-travelled. Chipped, dented, they stare at you with the unblinking eyes of their tape reels.

links.title: You: "Stand on the tips of your toes to s..."
links.text: Stand on the tips of your toes to see more...

links.title: Shelf of Boomboxes: "One especially catches your eye. De..."
links.text: One especially catches your eye. Deep gold and amber plastic with a big old handle on top. A classic boombox that says: "STEREO 8 approved."

links.title: Inland Empire: "This is you. Gold and orange. A sun..."
links.text: This is you. Gold and orange. A sunset suite.

links.title: Interfacing: "Just make sure it works before you..."
links.text: Just make sure it works before you buy it.

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]
